_description: Holly against Ivy — four monorhyming quatrains and burden: ‘Nay nay ive it may not be iwis / For holy must haue the mastry as the maner is’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Holy berith beris beris rede ynowghÞe tyrtyll
                    thristilcok þe popyngay dance in euery bowgh…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…With a payre of kybid helis cawght with coldSo wold I
                    þat euery man had þat with yvy will holdExplicit

BLHar5396.First Lines:
Holy stond in the hall fayre to beholdIuy stond without the dore
                    she ys ful sore a cold…
BLHar5396.Last Lines:
…Gode iuy what byrdys ast thouNon but the howlat that kreye
                    how how
BLHar5396.Note: “nay Iuy may hyt shal not be Iwys / Let holy hafe þe maystry as þe maner ys” written above first line; in this witness, couplets followed by one line of the burden written in abbreviated form to right.
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: A Song on the Ivy & the Holly  (added above by a later hand, f. 275v)
